result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

-Mental Health assessment and any follow-up.  If already done that will suffice.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

timeConds.notes: -Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.  Court allows the defendant to stager the jail time over the first year of probation.

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular - 03/06/2020
Hearing on July 10, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Copy of a letter from Corrections Administrator Lori Leahy to the defendant dated June 12, 2018 re: inmate check-in packet and defendant to contact the jail
from Atty Larry Lloyd dated May 21, 2018 re: no longer represents the defendant
from Lori Leahy-Corrections Administrator to the defendant dated May 3, 2018 re: jail sentence
to Sheriff Podoll from Hon. Mark T. Slate dated April 13, 2018 re: jail sentence
in Support of Motion
Defendant's (to amend jail sentence)

11:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Larry Lloyd.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Lloyd.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-60 days county jail.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.  Court allows the defendant to stager over the first year of probation.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Mental Health assessment and any follow-up.  If already done that will suffice.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended. 

Court adjourned at 11:18 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2018 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Larry Lloyd dated January 11, 2018 re: sentencing recommendation

Guilty - Count 1 (signed)

8:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Larry Lloyd.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lloyd - defendant still requests a jury trial.  Statement by the Court - one juror still needs to sign in.  Court has handed out closing jury instructions.  Court makes statement to Atty Lloyd.  Statement by DA Christenson - defendant has 3 prior convictions.  Atty Lloyd concurs.  Further statement by DA Christenson regarding a jury instruction.  Atty Lloyd concurs.  Further statement by DA Christenson regarding picture exhibits.  Statement by Atty Lloyd.

Court recess at 8:43 a.m.
Court reconvened at 8:53 a.m.  Same appearances.

Court has handed out an updated jury instruction and closing instructions.  Statement by DA Christenson regarding updated jury instruction.  Statement by Atty Lloyd - updated juror instruction is acceptable.  Statement by the Court regarding missing juror.  Statement by DA Christenson re: Deputy VandeKolk as court officer and requests him to remain in the courtroom.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court will allow Deputy VandeKolk to be court officer.

Jurors brought into the courtroom.  Court addresses jurors.  Jurors sworn by the Clerk.  Voir Dire begins.  Court makes statement to the jurors not selected.  Selected jurors impaneled and sworn.  Jurors returned to jury room.  Court makes statement to the jurors not selected.

Court recess at 9:41 a.m.
Court reconvened at 9:56 a.m.  Same appearances.

Statement by the Court in regards to element on juror instruction.  Court orders sequestrations of witnesses.  Jurors brought into the courtroom.  Court gives opening instructions to the jurors.  Opening statement by DA Christenson.  Opening statement by Atty Lloyd.  Defendant's Exhibit #1 - Photo.  Jurors returned to jury room. Statement by the Court in regards to opening statement by Atty Lloyd.  Jurors returned to the courtroom.

Matthew VandeKolk sworn, direct by DA Christenson is employed as Deputy for Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Goes over duties.  Testimony given.  Was employed on the date in question.  Venue established.  Cross examination by Atty Lloyd.

Michael A. Prachel sworn, direct by DA Christenson is employed as Deputy Sheriff for Green Lake County Sheriff's Department since 2009.  Was employed on the date in question.  Testimony given.  DA offers exhibit #2 - Photo.  No objectionby Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #2.  DA offers exhibit #3 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives exhibit #3.  DA offers State's Exhibit #4 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives Exhibit #4.  DA offers State's Exhibit #5 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #5.  DA offers exhibit #6 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #6.  DA offers exhibit #7 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #7.  DA offers exhibit #8 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #8.  DA offers exhibit #9 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #9.  DA offers exhibit #10 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #10.  DA offers exhibit #11 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #11.  DA offers exhibit #12 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #12.  DA offers exhibit #13 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #13.  DA offers exhibit #14 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #14.  DA offers exhibit #15 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #15.  DA offers exhibit #16 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #16.  DA offers exhibit #17 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #17.  DA offers exhibit #18 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #18.  DA offers exhibit #19 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #19.  DA offers exhibit #20 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #20.  DA offers exhibit #21 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #21.  DA offers exhibit #22 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #22.  DA offers exhibit #23 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #23.  DA offers exhibit #24 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #24.  DA offers exhibit #25 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #25.  DA offers exhibit #26 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #26.  DA offers exhibit #27 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #27.  DA offers exhibit #28 - Photo.  No objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court receives State's Exhibit #28.  Cross exam by Atty Lloyd.  Jurors to jury room.  Court receives all the State's exhibits 2 - 28.

Court recess at 11:17 a.m.
Court reconvened at 11:35 a.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors brought into the courtroom.

Kathryn Munsey sworn, direct by DA Christenson is the Health Officer for Green Lake County Health Department for 29 years.  Was employed on the date in question.  Testimony given.  Cross exam by Atty Lloyd.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Jurors to jury room.

Court recess at 11:55 a.m.
Court reconvened at 12:38 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors broguht into the courtroom.

Jennifer Zeleske sworn, direct by DA Christenson is employed by Green Lake County Health and Human Services as a Social Worker.  Was employed on the date in question.  Testimony given.  Identified the defendant present in court.  Cross exam by Atty Lloyd.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.

Patti Crump sworn, direct by DA Christenson was employed as a Detective for Green Lake County Sheriff's Department on the date in question . Testimony given.  No cross exam  State rests.  

Jurors to the jury room.  Statement by Atty Lloyd, defendant will not be testifying.  Defense rests.  Court questions defendant regarding testifying.  Court respects the defendant's decision not to testify.

Court recess at 12:52 p.m.
Court reconvened at 1:07 p.m.  Same appearances.

Court goes over jury instructions with counsel.  Court will make the agreed upon corrections.

Court recess at 1:19 p.m.
Court reconvened at 1:38 p.m.  Same Appearances.

Counsel have received the jury instructions with no corrections.  Jurors now present.  Court reads preliminary jury instructions to the jurors.  Argument by DA Christenson.  Argument by Atty Lloyd.  Further argument by DA Christenson.  Court reads the jury instructions.  Alternater juror drawn.  Bailiffs sworn.  Jurors to jury room for deliberation.  Court makes statement to the alternate juror.

Court recess at 2:08 p.m.
Court reconvened at 3:09 p.m.  Same appearances.

Statement by the court - the jury has reached a verdict.  Jurors brought into the courtroom.  Court quesions jury regarding verdict.  Court reads the verdict - finds the defendant Guilty of neglecting a child.  Court polls the jurors.  Jurors excused to the jury room.  DA Christenson moves for judgment.  NO objection by Atty Lloyd.  Court grants the states motion.  Court will set for hearing at a later date.  JA will contact counsel for scheduling.

Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m.

11:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Larry Lloyd.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lloyd - is proceeding to jury trial at this time and have submitted a counter offer.  Statement by Atty Vanden Branden - will not propose a settlement without jail time.  Statement by the Court. 

Court adjourned at 11:39 a.m.
Jury status hearing on December 19, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Statement by Atty Lloyd - received a settlement offer, but defendant is not in agreement with jail time.  Statement by ADA - will be recommending jail and is ok with a trial.  Court sets for status hearing on November 7, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.  All motions and witness lists are to be filed by November 6, 2017.

Court adjourned at 3:01 p.m.

2:05 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Larry Lloyd present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lloyd - was just appointed on this case.  Court removes the Jury Trial from the court calendar.  Statement by the Court in regards to recusal - will allows ten days.  Court sets for Status Hearing on September 5, 2017 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:07 p.m.

All motions and witness lists were to be filed by April 24, 2017.  Court sets for Jury Trial on August 17 & 18, 2017 at 8:15 a.m.  Court sets for Jury Status Hearing on July 25, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.  Mandatory appearance for defendant. 

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.

3:45 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - have an offer that the defendant will not accept, defendant has a case in Columbia Couty.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 25, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.  and all motions and witness lists to be filed by April 24, 2017. 

Court adjourned at 3:47 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

3:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by ADA Vanden Branden - matter was not completed in the other county, meeting was held in chambers.  Statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by ADA - have an offer in this case, and not too far apart.  Court sets for plea & Sentencing on February 28, 2017 at 2:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 3:20 p.m.

12:09 p.m. Defendant Chad Zimmerman in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow. Atty Vanden Branden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statement by Atty Zamzow re: tracking case in Columbia County. Statement by Atty Vanden Branden- will be contacting Columbia County in order to find out status.

COURT schedules status for December 20, 2016 at 2 p.m.

Status hearing on December 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 22, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Court sets for Status Hearing on November 22, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

8:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:57 a.m.
